text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with Santa maria-style beans this
is the classic side dish for that Santa
maria-style tri-tip we did not too long
ago so let me show you my version for
this famous California bean dish we're
going to take one pound of beans I'm
using pink beans and Santa Maria they
use something called pinky toes which it
just means a little pink bean you can
use any dry bean pinto bean if you can't
find anything else works fine are you
going to soak that overnight then you're
going to drain the water put it in a
stockpot and add enough cold water to
cover by a couple inches bring that up
to a simmer and then simmer that for one
hour and 45 minutes now in the meantime
we're going to make the sauce we're
going to add a couple strips of bacon to
a little saucepan here I'm using pepper
bacon you can use anything you want
we're going to cook that on medium heat
I don't want it really crispy I just
want it cooked all right and also not
going to drain the fat there's not going
to be that much but you want to keep the
fat in there very important for the
flavor this bean dish I'm going to add
my diced cooked ham cook that for about
a minute add two cloves of a crushed
garlic and just cook that for another
maybe thirty seconds a minute I don't
want that to brown and I'm going to add
the rest of the ingredients I have one
can of diced tomato you can also use
tomato sauce a lot of recipes call for
tomato sauce tomato puree and the summer
fresh tomato of course if you have it
use that a little bit of ketchup some
dry mustard some paprika some Chipotle
some sugar some salt some chili powder
I'm using ancho and a little pinch of
dry oregano all right so we're going to
mix that up
alright we're going to add about half a
cup of water give it a stir bring it up
to a simmer reduce it to very low and
just simmer this for about 30 minutes
and then we're going to do is we're
going to finish cooking this with the
beans alright so it's been about an hour
and 45 minutes the beans are just about
tender in fact they're tender but
they're not super falling apart tender
but what I want to do is finish cooking
them with the sauce so drain them
reserve about a cup
of the cooking liquid right so you see
that and then we're going to dump in our
sauce give it a stir bring this up to a
simmer and then reduce the heat to very
low and simmer that about 30 minutes
until the beans finish cooking it's
going to thicken up a little make sure
it's very low stir once in a while
beans will burn to the bottom of a pot
and you will have to throw away the
whole thing burn bean flavor is not good
they will permeate everything you have
to start over add a little more that
cooking liquid or water if it gets too
thick but that should be just about
right all right and that's it
Santa maria-style beans a great great
barbecue side dish you get that
smokiness from the bacon in the ham a
little bit of smokiness from the
chipotle pepper the tomato and the sugar
and the dry mustard gives it that kind
of barbecue Eve flavor but not not
overpowering just a great great side
dish this goes with anything but it
really goes great with that Santa
maria-style tri-tip or any kind of
barbecued beef which is what I served it
with all right and that's how we do it
in Santa Maria California even though
I've never been there
but if I went there it's how we do it
things but I just said then anyway check
the website for all the ingredient
amounts you know they'll be there and as
always enjoy
you
